150344665.review:
Released in 2020, Helltaker is an indie puzzle game developed by Polish studio Vanripper. With its unique mix of puzzle gameplay, anime-inspired artstyle, and demon girl waifus, Helltaker took the internet by storm and developed a dedicated cult following. In this review, we'll take a look at what makes this short but sweet game so enjoyable.

Helltaker is a grid-based puzzle game where the player takes on the role of the Helltaker - a man on a quest to build a harem of demon girls. The gameplay involves moving the Helltaker character on a grid to reach exit portals while avoiding enemies and obstacles. Each level has its own puzzle mechanic that requires careful movement and planning to solve. The puzzles start off simple but quickly ramp up in complexity, requiring creative solutions to reach the goal.

A key element of Helltaker's gameplay is the ability to recruit defeated demon girls to join your harem. This adds more bodies to move around on the grid and opens up new strategies for solving puzzles. It's immensely satisfying to clear a challenging level and get a cute new demon girl added to your collection.

Helltaker features a stylized, 1920s cartoon-inspired artstyle with flat colors and simple designs. The demon girls have varied looks ranging from cute and playful to seductive and badass. The minimalist but expressive art gives each girl a distinct personality. Small animated touches like idle animations and victory poses add charm and life to the characters. Overall, the art direction is very cohesive and integral to Helltaker's appeal.

Helltaker's jazz-inspired soundtrack perfectly complements the art deco aesthetic. Upbeat piano and brass tracks provide smooth background music for the puzzle solving gameplay. The music strikes a playful yet sinister tone, matching the game's theme of romance with demon girls. Several vocal tracks with lyrics sung by the demon girls add flavor and humor as well.

With its bite-sized length and engaging mix of puzzles, anime visuals, and demon girl collecting, Helltaker delivers a straightforward but immensely fun experience. The puzzles provide a solid challenge, the rewards of new character unlocks keep things fresh, and the charming art and music tie the whole package together. While short, Helltaker is an absolute joy from start to finish and stands as one of the most memorable indie games in recent years.

Hell taker is a fantastic game, It is a short puzzle game with the objective being to complete level's in a preset amount of moves and ask a demon gal to join your Harem. Hell taker is a very easy game, it comes with a God mode option for players who are having trouble completing a level and want a more relaxed experience. The Steam achievements that accompany the game adds some difficulty and gives players wanting a more challenging game play experience there fix. 
  
The art style in this game is cute and amazing. The music is also amazing, it provides the player with an upbeat mood to keep playing and not give up on a level. The characters in the game give off amazing personality that makes the player wish there was more interactive dialogue option. 

I am looking forward to see what the Devs can create with an amazing cast of characters in the future. 
( here's hoping for a visual novel or spin-off game. Maybe a Hell Taker 2!!!)

Overall, this is a fundamental game to add to your steam collection and the price is...Free!

149077665.review:
I finally got around to playing this and I was not disappointed. I believe this is one of the best game experiences I've had for the following reasons:

1.) The game is free, no micro-transactions, and short. Meaning all the content in the game is there to be enjoyed, there is no filler, no downtime, there is no pay to win, just the gameplay and the mild dating sim aspects which are all very polished.

2.) The soundtrack is incredible. Simple yet very engaging, I was jamming throughout the entire game, thus making it an even more enjoyable experience.

3.) The puzzles are challenging. The difficulty of the puzzles increases moderately every level, a classic linear difficulty, making each level passed feel more and more achieving. It was very satisfying to beat this game without skipping any levels, but even if you don't have the patience for that, as said just now, you can skip levels, making it a pleasurable experience for anyone, even those not seeking a challenge.

4.) The art is incredible. There are two styles used, the portrait drawings and the chibi animations. Both are done very well: the portraits detail the characters more attractive aspects while the chibi are cute. There is also some animation in certain portraits. It is evident that no corners were cut on the visual aspects of this game.

5.) The character designs are great. All of the characters are distinct from each other, with their own little personalities. If this was not present, the game would've felt dull and fighting to take these girls from Hell would've felt less accomplishing, very fortunately, that isn't the case.

I think anyone who can appreciate a good soundtrack, good puzzles, and some cute demon girls should definitely play the free and short experience of Helltaker.

148477905.review:
Helltaker is a banger!

A pretty good game with lots of charm, funny moments and pretty high difficulty if you wanna 100% it.
The characters are all pretty great and unique, and quite funny in their conversations.
The style of the game is also very well done, it kinda feels like some sort of comic book? (At least it felt like that to me...)
The game is difficult but not super difficult, and you can choose the levels that you want to do which is a cool touch for newer players.
Also, the few songs that it has are a bop!!
And it is FREE, woohoo!!

Overall, this is a pretty neat and cute little game.
However, I did find some flaws with it.
I value replayability in videogames and... I do not see myself replaying this game all that much, and it is because of the lack of content as well...
I get that this game was supposed to be small but this game is one of the ones I feel like it would benefit a lot from having more levels.

For a free game this is pretty neat, is not a favourite of mine, but I see why people like this game a lot (and also the characters).
Since, it's free, is more accessible to everyone and you will enjoy this game for the time you play, but again, content and replayability is lacking for me.

8.4/10

[h1]The Gameplay: [/h1]
Surprisingly fun little puzzle game that draws you in to play more. Even if you might have been just dipping your toe in, you might find yourself actually beating the game before you realize it. This does put the game in the short but sweet category.

[h1]The Story:[/h1]
You are a manly simp that has a demon girl fetish? Honestly it's terrible, but the characters are interesting to perform a short interaction with.

[h1]The Visuals:[/h1]
The strongest part about this game. The artwork of everything save for the actually live puzzles is actually very eye-catching.

[h1]The Sound:[/h1]
The strongest part of this  game, is the music, as it has solidified itself as meme dance song.  There is not much moe to it than that, good song.


[h1]The Experience:[/h1]
I saw this game, decided to try it for like 2 seconds and found myself compelled to beat the game. The datingsim lite puzzle game has a very strong appeal with artwork this good. Especially since the game is free, it's honestly a huge treat and a must-play.

147686971.review:
The acclaimed Helltaker. Finally got to it. And I have to say: I love it.

Now the question is, will you like it? Well, do you like:
A.) Demon girls?
B.) Harem?
C.) Funny light hearted dialogues?
D.) Good art?
E.) Good music?
F.)  2D puzzle games where you push blocks around to get to your goal?
G.) A little touch of bullet hell?

Well, I'd say if half of those requirements meet your quota, you'll definitely learn to like this game.

Really easy to learn and master. And you can even skip levels if it proves too difficult. Not that you need to since you've got YouTube to help you out. The bullet hell parts will get to you, but for a free game like this with this much labor of love, and for the short duration of it, how much can you actually complain.

And if those parts do get to you, there's good music playing with no cuts and no buts even when you die to keep motivating you to power through it.

Story is really straight forward packed full with characters (girls) adapted from pre-existing religious figures with a really funny and cute twist to it.

So, if the game strikes you good, just sit down for a few hours, beat it and beat it again, enjoy the girls and the story, and I'm sure you'll get a real kick out of it while figuring out who's your favourite waifu. (I'm still in between Zdrada or Judgement)

And if after all that, you still haven't scratched your itch, here are more demon girls that you may or may not like:
1. https://twitter.com/shibagani48
2. https://twitter.com/pcmaniac88
3. And the acclaimed developer: https://twitter.com/vanripperart

This and Princess Remedy are definitely one of my top tiered free games on Steam.

I'm out!

147330231.review:
[h1] Helltaker: A Devilishly Fun Puzzler with a Twist [/h1]

Hey there, ever daydreamed about having your own harem? Well, 'Helltaker' is a quirky little puzzle game that lets you live that fantasy – but with a twist. Instead of your run-of-the-mill harem, you're after a harem of demon girls. And let's be honest, who doesn't want a sharply dressed demon girl harem?

The game kicks off with you waking up one day with a singular goal in mind: amassing your own demon girl harem. To make it happen, you have to venture into hell itself, ready to kick anything and anyone that dares to stand in your way.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to bust these demon girls out of hell. But it's not as simple as just running up to them and saying, "Hey, join my harem!" No, no. You'll need to solve puzzles in each room to reach them. You've got a limited number of actions, and you'll need to figure out how to kick rocks and skeletons out of your way while avoiding traps that can sap your precious actions. If you fail, well, let's just say things won't end well. But if you succeed, the demon girl is all yours – well, assuming you choose the right dialogue option, or else, you might end up on the receiving end of some demon wrath.

The game even throws in a hint system called Life Advice, though it's more about adding depth to your interactions with the demon girls and between the girls themselves. Plus, there are hidden endings to discover, which adds to the fun.

Speaking of secrets, there are these inscriptions hidden in three levels. If you find them all and follow the given instructions in Chapter 10, you'll unlock a secret ending, an addition to your harem, and even some extras like concept art and a pancake recipe (which you can also buy as DLC to support the developer).

Now, there's one part that some Helltaker players didn't quite vibe with – the boss battle for the last demon girl. Instead of the usual puzzle room, you get a dynamic, dodging chains challenge. Personally, I thought it was a cool change of pace, but I get that it might be a bit fast-paced for some.

And let's talk about the artwork – it's gorgeous. The demon girls are cute to the point where it's impossible to pick a favorite, and the overall art style is a winner. Even the puzzle segments have a charming chibi-like aesthetic.

In short, 'Helltaker' is well worth checking out, especially if you're into puzzle games with a devilish twist and, well, demon girls. It's free, it's a blast, and it won't take up too much of your time. So, really, no excuses not to dive into this devilishly delightful adventure.

It took me 4.8 hours to get all the achievements (read the guide). The part of pushing the box to solve the puzzle is very interesting (I can’t pass the extra level of pushing the box without reading the guide). It’s a little difficult to avoid the barrage part, but after proficiency That's fine. The painting style of the game is a typical american comic style. The music is very rhythmic and upbeat, and people can't help shaking with the rhythm. The plot and the girls are very good. Although there is no Chinese, the plot itself is relatively short. It is okay to have an English foundation and translation software (mainly because there are more literary new words). Although the plot is short, the story is relatively complete. And this game is free, it is already very good to have such quality. If possible, buy a DLC to support the author.

143019048.review:
The Chernobyl disaster[a] was a nuclear accident that occurred on 26 April 1986 at the No. 4 reactor in the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, near the city of Pripyat in the north of the Ukrainian SSR in the Soviet Union.[1] Called the world's worst-ever civil nuclear incident,[2] it is one of only two nuclear energy accidents rated at seven—the maximum severity—on the International Nuclear Event Scale, the other being the 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster in Japan. The initial emergency response, together with later decontamination of the environment, involved more than 500,000 personnel and cost an estimated 18 billion roubles—roughly US $68 billion in 2019, adjusted for inflation.[3]

The accident occurred during a safety test meant to measure the ability of the steam turbine to power the emergency feedwater pumps of an RBMK-type nuclear reactor in the event of a simultaneous loss of external power and major coolant leak. During a planned decrease of reactor power in preparation for the test, the operators accidentally dropped power output to near-zero, due partially to xenon poisoning. While recovering from the power drop and stabilizing the reactor, the operators removed a number of control rods which exceeded limits set by the operating procedures. Upon test completion, the operators triggered a reactor shutdown. Due to a design flaw, this action resulted in localized increases in reactivity within the reactor (i.e., "positive scram"). That brought about the rupture of fuel channels and a rapid drop in pressure, thereby prompting the coolant to flash to steam. Neutron absorption thus dropped, leading to an increase in reactor activity, which further increased coolant temperatures (a positive feedback loop). This process led to steam explosions and the melting of the reactor core.[4]

The meltdown and explosions ruptured the reactor core and destroyed the reactor building. This was immediately followed by an open-air reactor core fire which lasted until 4 May 1986, during which airborne radioactive contaminants were released and deposited onto other parts of the USSR and Europe.[5][6] Approximately 70% landed in Byelorussia (now Belarus), 16 kilometres (9.9 mi) away.[7] The fire released about the same amount of radioactive material as the initial explosion.[3] In response to the initial accident, a 10-kilometre (6.2 mi) radius exclusion zone was created 36 hours after the accident, from which approximately 49,000 people were evacuated, primarily from Pripyat. The exclusion zone was later increased to a radius of 30 kilometres (19 mi), from which an additional ~68,000 people were evacuated.[8]

142076831.review:
Well, there is not much I can say about this game that has not already been said.

Helltaker is an puzzle/reaction game about a guy who wants to get a harem of demon girls. It's a simple game — and by that I mean that it features a simple core mechanic. But the actual levels are pretty hard. But if you there for a story, you can easily skip them through the menu (I won't confirm or deny whether I did that).
The gameplay itself is fun, even if challenging. The narrative is barely there, at least the plot aspect. All of the narrative skill points have been alotted to style and characterisation. And the game has reached maximum level in both of those departments.
Each demon girl is unique, in dialogue, appearance and the image. The dialogue is fun and witty, character poses expressive, and you will be left with the feeling that you could watch an entire 12-episode anime series about these characters.
And the game is [i]polised[/i]. From music to sound to the last icon and text formatting — for a free game this is an absolute masterclass in quality

Should you play it? Well, it's free, you don't actually have to [i]play[/i] it to get to the best bits, and for those who actually like brutally challenging puzzles, this will be a treat like no other.

El juego es realmente divertido y te aseguro que lo vas a querer volver a jugarlo, sin mencionar que la banda sonora es brutal, terminarás bailando y tarareando mientras juegas.
La comunidad creó y pulió un parche en español para que sea todavía más disfrutable.
Los diálogos de los personajes hacen del juego algo genial, te recomiendo jugar, lo vas a gozar.

(No todo se trata de tener un harem, Spider-man)
